title: Pipestone National Monument: Amphibians
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Amphibians                Amphibians         American Toad, Bufo americanus                                                                                                                                                                                          NPS, G. Wagner  Pipestone National Monument has a variety of ecosystems and is generally wet during the springtime. These conditions allow for the presence and reproductive success of several species of amphibians. The temporary pools created by the quartzite outcroppings as well as several small ephemeral wetlands provide suitable habitat for the following species at the Monument:       Scientific Name   Common Name     Bufo americanus   American Toad     Pseudacris triseriata   Western Chorus Frog     Ambystoma tigrinum   Tiger Salamander     Rana pipiens   Northern Leopard Frog     Eumeces septentrionalis   Northern Prairie Skink     Thamnophis radix   Plains Garter Snake     Chrysemys picta   Painted Turtle     Hyla versicolor/chrysoscelis   Cope's/Gray Treefrog     Chelydra serpentina   Common Snapping Turtle
